intro: Sium repandum, commonly known as water parsnip, is a flowering plant native to North America and parts of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as stream banks and marshes. Its roots are often used in traditional herbal medicine, though they can be toxic if not prepared properly. Sium repandum plays an important role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
